title: Is cynicism just a form of depression or a tool to be harnessed? - Quora

response.answer_text: cyn·i·cism ˈsinəˌsizəm/ noun 1. an inclination to believe that people are motivated purely by self-interest; skepticism."public cynicism about politics"synonyms:skepticism, doubt, distrust, mistrust, suspicion, disbelief.It certainly isn’t depression. Cynicism may be a reaction to a society which has turned its back on the Golden Rule. “Do unto others…” seems to have become “I’ve got mine; how’re you doin’?” Cynicism is a response to a problem that seems intractable because the truth of the problem will not be admitted by those invested in maintaining the problem.

Cynicism comes from the mouths of those who are sarcastic, scornful and skeptic about everything and everyone based on an inborn prejudice. This 'in-born' is not there forever! It can be forgiven when thinking is made less awry. Despite the fact that there is an admission that cynicism is being "out of one's depth" the habit can be willfully negated.
